title: Catcher Tatum claimed off waivers from Astros
subtitle: Catcher Tatum claimed off waivers from Astros
body: The D-backs claimed catcher Craig Tatum off waivers from the Astros, general manager Kevin Towers announced on Monday. Houston claimed Tatum on Oct. 28, after the 28-year-old catcher hit .245 with three doubles and seven RBIs in 31 games with the Orioles last year. Tatum also compiled a .200/.289/.246 batting line in 21 games with Triple-A Norfolk in 2011. Tatum made the Orioles' Major League roster out of Spring Training in 2010, and batted .281 with a .349 on-base percentage in 43 games. In 100 Major League games since 2009, Tatum is a career .223 hitter, with one home run, 22 RBIs and 52 strikeouts. He was drafted by the Reds in the third round of the 2004 First-Year Player Draft and made his big league debut with Cincinnati in 2009. Adam Berry is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Adam Berry
